summary: Honestly is too much to ask for a scene of Arya telling Sansa, Jon, Gendry, and the Hound (Bran probably already knows) what...
body: Honestly is too much to ask for a scene of Arya telling Sansa, Jon, Gendry, and the Hound (Bran probably already knows) what she’s been through. Just so she can talk to her loved ones about it and so they can do their best to help her heal even if they don’t understand it’s good to have someone you trust completely know what happened

tags: i just have a lot of feelings
summary: I just really, really wish that at some point someone - anyone - would look Bran in the eye, grab his shoulder/hands and tell...
body: I just really, really wish that at some point someone - anyone - would look Bran in the eye, grab his shoulder/hands and tell him “I’m sorry, you didn’t deserve anything that happened to you, you shouldn’t have to carry all that weight, you shouldn’t have to be a tree/memory storage system” because literally nobody seems to care about what that kid has been through or even considered that maybe Bran didn’t want to be reduced to a memory depository.

reblog.comment: I just really, really wish that at some point someone - anyone - would look Bran in the eye, grab his shoulder/hands and tell him “I’m sorry, you didn’t deserve anything that happened to you, you shouldn’t have to carry all that weight, you shouldn’t have to be a tree/memory storage system” because literally nobody seems to care about what that kid has been through or even considered that maybe Bran didn’t want to be reduced to a memory depository.

trail.content_raw: I just really, really wish that at some point someone - anyone - would look Bran in the eye, grab his shoulder/hands and tell him “I’m sorry, you didn’t deserve anything that happened to you, you shouldn’t have to carry all that weight, you shouldn’t have to be a tree/memory storage system” because literally nobody seems to care about what that kid has been through or even considered that maybe Bran didn’t want to be reduced to a memory depository.
trail.content: I just really, really wish that at some point someone - anyone - would look Bran in the eye, grab his shoulder/hands and tell him “I’m sorry, you didn’t deserve anything that happened to you, you shouldn’t have to carry all that weight, you shouldn’t have to be a tree/memory storage system” because literally nobody seems to care about what that kid has been through or even considered that maybe Bran didn’t want to be reduced to a memory depository.

summary: It [the head] came up near Greyjoy’s feet. Theon was a lean, dark youth of nineteen who found everything amusing. He laughed,...
body:
It [the head] came up near Greyjoy’s feet. Theon was a lean, dark youth of nineteen who found everything amusing. He laughed, put his boot on the head, and kicked it away.

—Bran, A Game of Thrones by George R.R. Martin

reblog.comment:

summary: Not a raven, but Isaac Hempstead-Wright met up with an avian fan at a zoo in Sydney.  It may look like an owl, but that is an...
caption:
Not a raven, but Isaac Hempstead-Wright met up with an avian fan at a zoo in Sydney.

It may look like an owl, but that is an iconic Australian bird called the tawny frogmouth. Its plumage is perfect for the House Stark.

summary: variety //  It gets a little silly in the end, but what Vlad says about the Night King wanting revenge because he never wanted...
body:
variety //

It gets a little silly in the end, but what Vlad says about the Night King wanting revenge because he never wanted to be the Night King is really interesting. Vlad never says where he gets those ideas from, but he must have got the idea from somewhere other than himself. 

I can’t verify this myself, but on the wikipedia page it says on the Season 4 Blu-ray commentary a lot more material was actually filmed with the Night King in “Oathkeeper”, but the production team then decided to cut it in order to keep his appearance brief and mysterious. If that’s true, then maybe Vlad has some knowledge about the character that we haven’t seen yet. 

I’ve written about what may be clues before (here, here, and here), and I know with only three episodes left it’s seriously unlikely that we’ll get any more on the Night King. But I still can’t help but feel like a lot doesn’t add up and that we’ve been purposely left with unanswered questions. 

I’m not sure what conclusion to make from the clues I’ve noticed, but I do know something strange is going on with Bran and the Night King. 

The Night King’s mark, Jojen saying Bran will have an end while looking at his flaming hand, Bran suspiciously Warging into the ravens *after* Theon tells him about the trenches being on fire, the Night King intervening *after* Bran’s ravens surround him,  Vlad’s tweet discussing how the Night King changes people/things by touching them with the emphasis on Bran’s mark… and so many other details that are suspicious. 

So if Vlad’s take on the NK is accurate, then maybe the NK did want to become Bran.

I guess we’ll know in a few weeks, but I’m hoping that the NK isn’t defeated and that we get a glimpse of that (or more) in the last episodes.

reblog.comment:

We learn early on to not expect anything from them, but when you least expect they start badmouthing...

summary: Bran will stay at Winterfell with Sansa right?  I hope that it is true we can see more of the relationship between them and...
question: Bran will stay at Winterfell with Sansa right?  I hope that it is true we can see more of the relationship between them and maybe we will see them having secret conversations, I mean if Sansa's kidnapping will happen, maybe Bran will tell her and they can come up with something?.
answer:
I would die for this. I’d like a scene where Sansa asks Bran what he wants to do now that the Night King is done. I want them working on fixing the North together. Maybe Bran can clue Sansa in on some future events or maybe they sit together in the evenings just to relax.

Watch D&D ignore the fact that they’re related for 3 ep

body:
Jon is my boy but…

I think one thing people forget when they’re like the night king and Jon are enemies they should have fought. Is simply that the knight king doesn’t give a fuck about Jon. Bran is his enemy because he holds the history of humans he’s their memory. Jon is practically this guy that keeps showing up and losing or running away from the night king. Night King doesn’t have time to fight Jon’s ass cause he doesn’t give a fuck he has been after Bran this whole time and Jon just keeps popping up in between.
